item.title: Buy your items from jagex :)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

thats exactly what it is, no need to doubt it this is public information. its like a hash of the card number + expiry date and some private key stuff with a key that only the issuing bank holds. the whole point of the cvv is that it means you are definitely in possession of the card because there is nowhere else that the number is stored.

edit:

“The VISA CVV service generate callable service calculates a 1- to 5-byte value through the DES-encryption of the PAN, the card expiration date, and the service code using two data-encrypting keys or two MAC keys. The VISA CVV service verify callable service calculates the CVV by the same method, compares it to the CVV supplied by the application (which reads the credit card’s magnetic stripe) in the CVV_value, and issues a return code that indicates whether the card is authentic.”

http://publibz.boulder.ibm.com/cgi-bin/bookmgr_OS390/BOOKS/CSFB4Z20/2.4.2?SHELF=&DT=20020114105428

Read full topic

item.title: Buy your items from jagex :)
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It’s CVV

And yes, TL is correct. There’s basically two stages to taking payment from a CC, Authorisation and Capture - the CVV2 is only required for Authorisation, and Captures can be authorised using previous Captures as verification, to allow recurring payments without having to store the CVV (which nobody can do, even the banks - literally the only place your CVV2 exists is on the back of your card, there is no database anywhere)

Read full topic

[/quote]well, you could purchase the spins without having to enter your CCV?[/quote]

Yeah you can do that without storing the CCV. I don’t know the specific details of it, after the first authorisation you have essentially authorised that merchant to be trusted and to do things like recurring payments and other future payments without the need for them to store more information than they need to.

Many people have tried: clicking the “buy spins” button in-game will redirect you to their website where you simply click continue without having to confirm anything (apart from logging in) and voila, you have two gazillion spins on your account.

item.title: Buy your items from jagex :)
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Here’s a quote from Mod Xan on the forums regarding players’ questions on the issue:

If by quick access to buying spins you're referring to saving your card details onto the account for future purchases, this is both optional and also completely separate to your recurring subscription. This option simply stores your credit card information (discretely, nobody can read the actual full card number, not even you!) on the account so you can make extra purchases such as spins. This isn't connected in any way to a recurring subscription - choosing not to store your details or removing these from the account won't stop your recurring membership subscription from continuing.

If you don’t want your card details stored on the account, just head back to the subscription page and, where your stored credit card options are shown, click “manage saved cards”.

Recurring subscriptions and the option to save your card details are two separate things, and aren’t directly related.

Saving your card basically means that those details will be available for any new purchases or agreements on our website (e.g. anything that would require you to actually return to the main payment page). So this includes a totally new subscription being set up, or Squeal of Fortune spins, or WoLCash, etc., but isn’t involved in automatic payments made as part of a single subscription - these only require a single visit to the payment page, and then carry on automatically until you cancel the agreement.


RuneScape

RuneScape Forum - Community Forums for Clans, Feedback & Discussion

Join the discussion on the official RuneScape forum. Share your thoughts with the community, ask questions, find help, learn about events and much more.

Read full topic
